docs.title: Conda
docs.text:
Conda can be used to create isolated Python environments.

  • Create a new environment: conda create -n myenv
  • Activate base environment: source activate base
  • Activate environment: conda activate myenv
  • Deactivate environment: conda deactivate
  • List environments: conda env list

docs.title: Modules
docs.text:
Environment modules allow you to load and use specific versions of software on the cluster.

  • List available modules: module avail
  • Load a module: module load <module_name>
  • Unload a module: module unload <module_name>

For examples using Conda, see the Conda guide.

docs.title: Available Software
docs.text:
• R – Statistical computing and graphics
  • MPI – Message Passing Interface for parallel computing
  • Ollama – Ollama
  • Python – Python programming language
  • Conda – Environment and package management system
  • Miniforge – Minimal Conda distribution

For instructions on loading and managing software, see the Modules guide and Conda guide.
